{"step_by_step_thinking": "Diarthroses are freely movable joints. Plane, condyloid, and saddle joints are all types of diarthroses, meaning they allow for a wide range of movement. On the other hand, symphyses are a type of amphiarthroses, which are slightly movable joints. Therefore, symphyses are not a type of diarthroses.", "answer_choice": "B. Symphyses."}
